result.execSummary:
The defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with defendant's current sentence.  Huber privileges for work.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 45 days, concurrent with the defendant's current sentence, with Huber privileges for work, with credit for 2 days.
.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges, and restitution, if any, from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges within 6 months of today's date, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.  The Court admonished the defendant that, pursuant to Federal Law, he may not possess a firearm.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant was sentenced on his other cases and sent to the House of Correction and was not produced for today's date.
Case adjourned for another sentencing date in branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Jury trial date of 09/23/2015 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests a status counsel date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Note from Defense Counsel with name of Consuelo Reyes (3rd party contact) with telephone number and address listed.

Defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set as a Bail/Bond Hearing.
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Discussion regarding modification of the no contact order. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court held side bar conference with both parties. In regards to 3rd party contact for purposes of child care/visitation/exchange defendant to provide name of potential 3rd party contact the he state by 5:00 PM. Case adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Due to defendant's statements to the Court regarding the children, Court orders case adjourned for bail hearing in Branch 23.

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dina A-T.,  AND/OR   Maricela D-L.,    AND/OR   their residences    AND/OR  their places of employment

Defendant Cuauhtli E Lara Espinosa in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-087

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23 for a Pretrial Conference.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/15 @ 1:30pm
